text: The Battle of Valverde was an American Civil War battle fought from February 20 to February 21, 1862.John Taylor, Bloody Valverde: A Civil War Battle on the Rio Grande, February 21, 1862 (Albuquerque: University of New Mexico Press, 1999), p. 150 It was fought near the present day town of Valverde, New Mexico. This town was at a ford across the Rio Grande river in what was at the time Confederate Arizona.Joseph P. Sánchez; Robert L. Spude; Art Gómez, New Mexico: A History (Norman: University of Oklahoma Press, 2013), pp. 131–32 The battle was a major success in the New Mexico campaign of the Southern states. The Confederate cavalry from Texas and several companies of Arizona militia fought Union Army regulars and Union volunteers from northern New Mexico and Colorado. Colonel Kit Carson commanded the 1st New Mexico (Union) Infantry.Edwin Legrand Sabin, Kit Carson Days (1809-1868) (Chicago: A.C.
